title: Toxicity Levels
body:
Hi,

I'm sure this has already been discussed many times, but I've certainly missed it and would love somebody (Dev would be great) to shed some light for me.

I've been playing lol since season two, and I'll be honest, I love the game, and I never thought I would be able to watch a game as much as I do. I was even privileged enough to Coach a OCE challenger team, brief though it was as the team disbanded and I was unlucky in that I came in at the end of the season.

Anyways, to my point:

What is going on with the toxicity in this game, with regards to, how and why am I still playing every game with some toxic child? I'm certainly not the first person to encounter them, and certainly not the first person to report them. I understand that at times we may type inappropriate things from the safety of our bedroom, but you as a player know when you come across a kid who acts like this every game. To the devs, don't you just read the in game transcript and click the ban button? I know I've given detailed feedback that suggests this person should only be allowed to play with people alike himself, and on that note, how many chances do they get? Like i said, it's at the point where  every game now my poor mother is insulted by a fourteen year old kid :P (mum jokes don't offend) but regardless it's still a pain to play with. My brother wanted to play lol but left shortly after on the sole basis that the community is disgusting. 

Now I know I'm preaching to the choir, but as I said, do these kids even get banned, or is it just a facade placed before us to think the community is being bettered? Perhaps it's just me, but I do not believe that with the toxicity of some player that there needs to be a certain number of reports to identify if the person is in fact a social outcast, and to be perfectly honest I'm at the point where I don't think the devs actually care, but I hope I'm wrong.

It's time riot created this league of children server, wherein if you want to act like a child, you play with other children and have a storm of toxic rain, it would certainly make for some entertaining youtube videos. But perhaps that's my vindictive side coming out, but hey, I play lol to escape an unpleasant reality, as I'm sure many others do, and the last thing I want is for someone to intentionally ruin that to sate some sadistic tendency developed from lack of social skills.

Thanks.

I really don't give a shit what's going on in the lives of the people I play with. Their stories mean less than nothing to me. I'm not here to hold their hand and play councilor. Amongst other things that creates a losing atmosphere, it pisses me off when people allow personal mental issues that exist outside the game to influence what happens *in* game. If you can't leave your crap at the door, crap that can affect the outcome of the game, then don't play. Full stop. 
This may be news to you, but the game isn't just about you, or just for you. Go play a single player game and stop deliberately screwing over people playing games where the outcome relies almost totally on team cooperation.
Sometimes you just have to accept your personal limitations, like them or not. No one ever promised a fair life.
You might think what I've said to be harsh but consider this:  People don't hit 'Play' so they can have your issues and the issues of others like you forced upon them. I can promise you it's **not** what I play for. 

So why do you think is it OK for you to force your issues upon us? Especially considering Riot themselves have told you on numerous occasions, by banning account after account you have created, that they don't think this game is right for you?

**If you know full and well you have uncontrollable mental issues that often affect yourself and, by association, other people playing with you during competitive gaming sessions, and you insist on continuing to play those games, then you are the posterchild for what this community does not need or want.**

I recommend you find treatment for your illness. 

Issues like this may escalate if left untreated or remain for extended periods of time (which will greatly impact your life). Even if it does go away, there's a good chance it might come back later on.

+ If you live in Australia you are entitled visit a psychiatrist for free under the Better Access initiative (part of Medicare).


+ If you live in NZ you can visit your GP for $30 - $40. GPs are qualified to assess and treat mental illness, he/she can inform you about further treatment as well. 

 You may be also eligible for some free treatment under the [Mental Health Act](http://www.legislation.govt.nz/act/public/1992/0046/latest/whole.html). Your GP should be able to let you know if you are.

I don't mean to scare you but some mental heath disorders can be very serious. 
Early treatment could save your life.

So first a bit of insight on the [Instant Feedback System](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/207489286-Instant-Feedback-System-FAQ-):

+ When you report someone in-game for toxicity it goes through Instant Feedback. 

 This is an automated system, but it does work pretty well and people do get punished by it all the time. Just scroll down the PB board and you'll find countless posts, either people complaining about their ban, or asking how to reform their behaviour.


You also said:

_"I do not believe that with the toxicity of some player that there needs to be a certain number of reports to identify if the person is in fact a social outcast"_

The system doesn't really work like that, I'll clarify briefly here:

 + Bans by the IFS don't require multiple reports for punishment (although multiple reports in a row is a warning sign that something is wrong). Instead of report quantity, the IFS is more focused on evidence. 

 If you report someone and their chat logs show clear evidence of unacceptable behavior, then the system will issue punishment. Even if that player has never been reported before.

__*

_If the Instant Feedback system working well, why do I still see "toxic kids" in every game?_

Great question! There's two main reasons for that:

+ You actually touched on part of the answer when you said this; _"I understand that at times we may type inappropriate things from the safety of our bedroom"_.

 Your average League player might only flame once or twice a year, and maybe get very salty 5 - 6 times a year.

 The issue is that in the space of only 10 - 11 games you'll encounter almost 100 different players. Suddenly the chances of encountering a toxic player at some point become really high.

 This is where the majority of League's toxicity comes from, just people having a rare bad day. The really "toxic kids" only account for around 10% of toxicity. 


+ [Negativity Bias](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Negativity_bias) also plays a big role here.

 Even though you claim you're _"playing every game with some toxic child"_, I know you're just exaggerating. It might seem like that some days, but that's only because the impact of negative experiences is greater than positive ones.

 If I just think back to early childhood, I instantly recall more negative experiences. League is the same, when you look back on the previous day you're more likely to remember the toxic game, than a game which went smoothly.

  Our fellow Emissary **Sera's** has a really cool exercise you can do to track your Negativity Biases. Check it out [here](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behaviour/xvZeJNIU-riot-please-try-to-fix-your-community?comment=000100000000).

I hope that clears things up, feel free to reply with any comments or questions.
(Also your military service experience was very touching, thank you for sharing it with us :D)

Honestly, the toxicity in this game has been nowhere near as bad as I'd expected. I'm a total noob, still a few levels off 30 and terrible at the game, so I don't know what it's like in ranked, but for the most part in normals it's been okay 80% of the time. The other 20% of the time, yes, there's some reprehensible specimen who seems to derive their only satisfaction in life by being as despicable as possible. But on the whole, actual toxicity hasn't been too intolerable.

However... the thing that really, really gets to me is how seriously people take this game, and how astonished people seem to be when they encounter someone like me, ie genuinely terrible and not too worried about being terrible. I would have thought that people who played this game enough would have realised that it you're queuing with random people, some of those people are going to be much, much worse at the game than they are.

Side note: the thing that's really struck me about this game's community is that people are so proud of how 'difficult' the game is, how steep the learning curve is, and yet the same people profess to be baffled by how much other people (usually me) suck at LoL.

Another side note: If people call you 'kid' because you're raging like a toxic child, and yet you are an adult, that should be a source of even more shame for you.
I dont know where we went wrong, but the feelings gone and i just cant get it back.
